availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hezekiah P. Procter (Simpson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Catherine Morton Procter in Logan County, Kentucky, on March 8, 1836. Father of James S. Procter, Hezekiah A. Procter, Georgia Ann Procter, Robert B. Procter, Lewis Procter, and Louisa Procter. Resident in Simpson County, Kentucky, in 1840. Owned two enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1840. Blacksmith in Simpson County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1850. Employed L. M. Morton as an apprentice in Simpson County in 1850. Farmer in Simpson County in 1860. Employed Elisha Neal and Robert Bowman as laborers in Simpson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 186.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 50B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 877.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 18.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Logan County Marriages, Film #000364550, p. 127.
Find A Grave, "Hezekiah P. Procter (1 Mar 1813-6 May 1889)," Memorial #173353909, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/173353909 (accessed September 4, 2020).
